title: Caribbean nations grapple with deaths, destruction after Hurricane Melissa | ABC NEWS
description: Hurricane Melissa has left a trail of devastation across Jamaica, Haiti, Cuba, and the Bahamas. Dozens of people have died with the toll expected to rise. Residents are assessing the damage in the aftermath of the catastrophic storm. title: Albanese confident on AUKUS despite Korean subs promise | ABC NEWS
description: South Korea's president hosted a dinner on the sidelines of the APEC summit to honour President Donald Trump. Anthony Albanese is one of only six other world leaders to be invited to the dinner. Trump announced on Wednesday, local time, he would green-light South Korea's request to access nuclear-powered submarine technology, in a sharp break from the Biden administration. Anthony Albanese later brushed off questions about the consequences of that request for AUKUS, saying he is confident the Trump administration can deliver on both pacts. Political reporter Stephanie Borys explains from South Korea. title: Trump to reduce tariffs on Beijing amid resumed US nuclear weapons testing | ABC NEWS
description: The US and China have reached a deal to ease trade tensions on the sidelines of the APEC Summit in South Korea. title: NSW prison officers ordered back to work amid strike over assault on guards | ABC NEWS
description: All 13,000 NSW prisoners have been placed in lockdown amid a snap strike by correctional officers. description: A community is mourning the tragic death of a young cricketer during practice. 17-year-old Ben Austin was training with team mates at practice nets in Melbourne's east when he was struck by a ball in the neck. title: Environment minister warns 'it's now or never' for environment law overhaul | ABC NEWS
description: It's now or never: That's the warning from the Federal Environment Minister as he seeks parliamentary approval for a long-awaited overhaul of the nation's environment laws. There's broad consensus that the current regime is bad for the environment, and for business. Murray Watt insists his revamped plan would be good for both. title: Trump's resumption of nuclear testing sets 'unnerving' precedent, expert says | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump has ordered the Department of Defense to resume testing nuclear weapons for the first time in over 30 years. Nuclear weapons expert Dr Maria Rost Rublee says the move sets an "unnerving" precedent for other nations to commence their own tests, with none doing so since North Korea in 2017. title: Details of the rejected settlement offer in the defamation trial of Senator Price | ABC NEWS
description: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price rejected an offer to settle a defamation lawsuit two months before making a public appeal for money to help fund her Federal Court trial.  The senator is being sued by the chief executive the Central Land Council, Lesley Turner, over a press release distributed by her office in July 2024 which claimed Mr Turner was no longer fit to be CEO due to "unprofessional conduct".  Court reporter Olivana Lathouris has more for ABC News Northern Territory.
